{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3299284,"name":null,"username":"jennyfrc","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/cc9497/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-01T05:00:21.639Z","cooked":"

I’m trying to test out some code using opencv for AprilTag detection. However, I’ve been unable to get past the robotpy sync stage with this. I know for a fact that I have opencv installed:


I’ve tried to add this to the requires = list in pyproject.toml using “cv2” and “opencv-python”. No matter what I try, I get something like this during the sync step:

image933×74 3.31 KB

Does anybody have some suggestions for how to get around this?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2024-02-01T05:00:21.639Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":19,"reads":34,"readers_count":33,"score":101.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":452880,"topic_slug":"error-deploying-opencv","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/f/3/f3182e7ec093b2438831dea8d4faeb87ff129009.png","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62967,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/error-deploying-opencv/452880/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3299292,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-01T05:13:15.250Z","cooked":"

Use robotpy-opencv.

requires = [
    "robotpy-opencv; platform_machine == 'roborio'",
    "opencv-python; platform_machine != 'roborio'"
]

… we should probably document that somewhere.

Thank you for your help, and adding that to the toml file did fix the problem. I’m just trying to understand one thing now. If I take out the platform_machine part and just include “robotpy-opencv” in the requires list, I get the following error.

image971×175 7.29 KB

Just for my own understanding, why does including plaform_machine make a difference?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2024-02-02T01:04:56.786Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":16,"readers_count":15,"score":8.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":452880,"topic_slug":"error-deploying-opencv","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/1/8/1859a930754b1f895ff3db94b162dd48935eacd9.png","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62967,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/error-deploying-opencv/452880/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3299932,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-02T01:16:26.583Z","cooked":"

The platform_machine thing is a python environment marker (PEP 508 – Dependency specification for Python Software Packages | peps.python.org) that tells pip to use a package in a particular case.

In this case, robotpy-opencv is only available for roborio, we don’t publish it for other platforms. In the same way, opencv-python is not available for roborio, but it is available for desktop platforms.
